channel.title: Cape trimming
channel.description: okay on my cape trimming i use [code]if(playerHasItemAmount(14073, 1) && trimcape >= 2)//att {[/code] and [code]if(playerLevel[0] == 100) { trimcape += 1; }[/code] both in my process, but it auto maticly trims one if you only have 1 100 stat, how can i make it so it stops counting it edit: i did do this for all skillcapes, i think it just keep counting tho.

item.title: Cape trimming
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Thanks Rich ill try that now.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Cape trimming
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Rich im trying to work out how to do this too I have it in my initialize and level up methods but could explain how to make it do banked and inventory ones?

Read full topic

item.title: Cape trimming
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

You don’t have to process it, you can just check it in the level up method. Also, just loop through everything that stores players items (equipment, bank, inventory, etc) for a untrimmed skillcape after they’ve gotten two 99 stats, and replace them.

Read full topic

item.title: Cape trimming
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

if(playerLevel[0] == 100)
{
trimcape += 1;
}

You should have that in ur level up method not your process

Read full topic

item.title: Cape trimming
item.dc:creator: @pure_barrage pure barrage
item.description:
@pure_barrage wrote:

okay on my cape trimming i use

if(playerHasItemAmount(14073, 1) && trimcape >= 2)//att {
and

if(playerLevel[0] == 100) { trimcape += 1; }
both in my process, but it auto maticly trims one if you only have 1 100 stat, how can i make it so it stops counting it
edit:
i did do this for all skillcapes, i think it just keep counting tho.

Read full topic
